checkers.flow

Class DefaultFlowState

  • @Nullable java.lang.Object
    • checkers.flow.DefaultFlowState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FlowState
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NullnessFlowState

    public class DefaultFlowState
extends @Nullable Object
implements FlowState
    Stores the annotation that is inferred for each variable.

    • Field Detail

      • annotations

        protected final Set<@Nullable AnnotationMirror> annotations
        The annotations (qualifiers) to infer. The relationship among them is determined using the parameter to "and" and "or". By consulting the hierarchy, the analysis will only infer a qualifier on a type if it is more restrictive (i.e. a subtype) than the existing qualifier for that type.

      • vars

        public List<VariableElement> vars
        Maps variables to a bit index. This index is also used as the bit index to determine a variable's annotatedness using annos. In a previous implementation, vars was only copied when visitBlock or visitMethod was invoked. We now copy this field whenever we need to copy the state. TODO: look whether it's worth to optimize this.
        See Also:
        annos

      • annos

        public GenKillBits<@Nullable AnnotationMirror> annos
        Tracks the annotated state of each variable during flow. Bit indices correspond exactly to indices in vars.

    • Method Detail

      • createFlowState

        public DefaultFlowState createFlowState(Set<@Nullable AnnotationMirror> annotations)
        Description copied from interface: FlowState
        Create a new instance of the current flow state class. The type of the returned object has to be the same as the type of the receiver. This is used in FlowState.copy() to create a new instance of the correct type.
        Specified by:
        createFlowState in interface FlowState
        Parameters:
        annotations - The annotations that can be inferred.
        Returns:
        A new flow state instance.

      • copy

        public DefaultFlowState copy()
        Description copied from interface: FlowState
        Deeply copy the state of the current flow state. The type of the returned object has to be the same as the type of the receiver.
        Specified by:
        copy in interface FlowState
        Returns:
        A completely independent copy of this.
